title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 25 March 2016 - XWiki
content:

11:10 <fitz> has joined #xwiki  
12:18 <M-mouhb> Hello  
12:18 <M-mouhb> I am writing tests for a wiki macro as explained on xwiki.org documentation (http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Testing#HXARTesting).  
12:19 <M-mouhb> I have an issue when I invoke the method loadPage(org.xwiki.model.reference.DocumentReference reference) of the class: PageTest  
12:19 <M-mouhb> When I tested this method with a simple wiki page (whithout objects attached), the method do not generates errors and the maven test was ok.But when I tested it with a page that contains objects I have the following error in maven tests.  
12:19 <M-mouhb> Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: Failed to load component for type [interface com.xpn.xwiki.internal.objects.classes.PropertyClassProvider] for hint [TextArea]  
12:19 <M-mouhb> Find the full error here: https://ncry.pt/p/bKBn#KH-wUpK1faB7osLTg-LWY\_zNsz5B5BuwCgOTPtlvt6A  
12:19 <vmassol> mflorea: you've chosen a complex way :)  
12:19 <vmassol> see my comments about thomas's  
12:19 <vmassol> s/mflorea/M-mflorea  
12:19 <vmassol> grrr  
12:20 <vmassol> I meant M-mouhb  
12:20 <M-mouhb> ok ... thx  
12:21 <vmassol> the error you get simply means you're missing the component in the CM  
12:45 <newbie> has joined #xwiki  
12:47 <newbie> has quit  
12:49 <fitz> has quit  
12:53 <fitz> has joined #xwiki  
12:59 <fitz> I am new, and I'm very interested in this project,XWiki authenticator Android. I have submitted the application for Gsoc2016. What should I do next? Could anyone give me some advice?  
13:34 <cjd> has quit  
13:35 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
13:41 <woshilapin> has quit  
13:49 <acotiuga> has quit  
13:54 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
13:58 <avisser> has joined #xwiki  
14:04 <tmortagne> Hi fitz  
14:05 <tmortagne> you can find various information about the project as answer to other student on the dev mailing list  
14:05 <tmortagne> let me give you the links  
14:05 <tmortagne> http://markmail.org/message/dcrgai4pk2mqcgms  
14:06 <tmortagne> http://markmail.org/message/q4wpqtxfzkppdux2  
14:32 <vmassol> fyi "The Apache Commons Team is pleased to announce the availability of Apache Commons Configuration 2.0."  
14:34 <Enygma`> fitz: Welcome!  
14:35 <Enygma`> ideally, you could include in your application some more details / analysis on the work involved for the project  
14:35 <Enygma`> (though mind the deadline which is in 5 hours)  
14:36 <Enygma`> and you could even send a mail on the XWIki mailing list to introduce yourself to the community.  
14:37 <Enygma`> fitz: of course, you should/could also ask more questions to help you better understand the project and to better formulate the details that you could add to your application  
14:39 <fitz> hello tmortagne,Enygma. thank you very much for your response. and I will add more details in my proposal before the deadline. thank you~  
15:01 <msmeria> has quit  
15:05 <avisser> has quit  
15:05 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
15:08 <avisser> has joined #xwiki  
15:20 <acotiuga> Hello! Havig A.B.C.WebHome, is there any way to get A.WebPreferences, A.B.WebPreferences and A.B.C.WebPreferences? I would like then to check if the documents exist and if they contain any object. In other words could I get the list of spaces ?  
15:25 <vmassol> acotiuga: what's the use case?  
15:26 <acotiuga> The RatingConfig inheritance  
15:26 <acotiuga> at this moment there is a condition to get the RatingConfig object  
15:26 <acotiuga> #if($xwiki.exists($webPrefDoc) && $webPrefDoc.getObjectNumbers($configClass) > 0)   #set($configObj = $webPrefDoc.getObject($configClass)) #else   #set($configObj = $globalConfigDoc.getObject($configClass)) #end  
15:27 <acotiuga> for my example this checks only if A.B.C.WebPreferences have the object  
15:27 <vmassol> that's not very good to store stuff in webpreferences  
15:28 <acotiuga> hmm, now it's stored there  
15:28 <vmassol> the best practice is that each app should store it in its Config class  
15:28 <vmassol> let me find the doc  
15:28 <vmassol> (if I can find it ;))  
15:28 <acotiuga> XWiki.Ratings.xml  
15:28 <vmassol> hmm we're missing it in http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/ApplicationDevelopmentBestPractices  
15:28 <acotiuga> in XWiki.UIExtensionClass  
15:29 <vmassol> so basically apps should have some <app name>Config page  
15:29 <vmassol> to hold the configuration  
15:29 <vmassol> for the app  
15:29 <vmassol> e.g. MailConfig  
15:29 <vmassol> Annotationconfig, etc  
15:29 <vmassol> \*AnnotationConfig  
15:30 <acotiuga> This would come in addition to my use case, as what I'm trying to achieve is to have some specific configuration for an application  
15:30 <vmassol> but tmortagne should know better for the ratings app since he was part of the design  
15:30 <vmassol> "as what I'm trying to achieve is to have some specific configuration for an application" seems we're talking about the sam thing then  
15:30 <vmassol> so why webpreferences?  
15:31 <tmortagne> vmassol: this application was not done from scratch and I was not part of this part of rating application design :)  
15:31 <acotiuga> I guess because rating app is bundled in xwiki  
15:31 <vmassol> still you're our expert now tmortagne :)  
15:32 <vmassol> acotiuga:  I don't see the relationship  
15:32 <tmortagne> does not mean I can tell you why webpreferences was chosen back then  
15:32 <vmassol> sure  
15:32 <vmassol> in the past we were putting all our cofig in xwikiprefs and webprefs  
15:32 <vmassol> \*config  
15:32 <vmassol> but we stopped doing this a long time ago now  
15:32 <vmassol> (@acotiuga)  
15:33 <acotiuga> now the ratings configurations can be set at different levels http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Ratings+Application#HNewconfigurationsource  
15:33 <vmassol> I think what I did in some app was to check if there's a config page in the local wiki and if not, fall back on a config page in the main wiki  
15:34 <vmassol> acotiuga: ok  
15:34 <vmassol> so the only thing to change in the future is to have a RatingsConfig in the space  
15:35 <vmassol> if the use case is still needed  
15:35 <vmassol> so back to your question  
15:35 <vmassol> you need to find if a doc exists at the current space lavel? that's easy  
15:35 <vmassol> \*level  
15:35 <vmassol> if you need to navigate you'll start from the current doc reference and go up the reference tree  
15:36 <vmassol> getLastSpaceReference() and then getParent() till the EntityType becomes different from SPACE  
15:36 <vmassol> does that answer your question?  
15:37 <acotiuga> Yes, but I was thinking that maybe there could be a way to ge something like an array... like [A, A.B, A.B.C] ...  
15:39 <acotiuga>  I guess it would be nice to be able to loop through the levels  
15:40 <vmassol> are you in java?  
15:40 <vmassol> because otherwise the issue is probably that you're ,ot  
15:40 <vmassol> \*not  
15:41 <acotiuga> ok, I'm not  
15:41 <vmassol> this looks like some code that should be in java  
15:41 <vmassol> to return the configuration  
15:41 <vmassol> tmortagne: wdyt?  
15:41 <tmortagne> yes should probably be in RatingsScriptService  
15:43 <tmortagne> some getConfigurationProperty(String) API which take care of searching for the configuration property trough current entity hierarchy  
15:45 <acotiuga> the String parameter being the hierarchy A.B.C?  
15:51 <acotiuga> I see, the property  
16:02 <tmortagne> no the string being the property name  
16:02 <tmortagne> getConfigurationProperty would look at the context for the hirarchy  
16:03 <tmortagne> test current space, then its parent, etc.  
16:03 <tmortagne> maybe add a getConfigurationProperty(String, EntityReference) but not sure we really have the need  
16:24 <vmassol> I'd return the config data to not have to find the config every time you ask for a property  
16:27 <acotiuga> I searched more in the ratings module and I think something else should be done to solve my problem. The problem seems to be here: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/0f5b636ea0eb6e761bc613bd8bc8995bd200f2d9/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-ratings/xwiki-platform-ratings-api/src/main/java/org/xwiki/ratings/internal/AbstractRatingsManager.java#L97  
16:28 <acotiuga> It should iterate all the spaces in the hierarchy before the fallback to the global configuration  
16:29 <acotiuga> My config doc is skipped because is A.WebPreferences and the rating service checks A.B.C.WebPreferences and if doesn't exists, it sets to global config  
16:30 <tmortagne> acotiuga: yes rating application was probably not updated after nested spaces introduction  
16:32 <acotiuga> So in order to follow the inheritance rule, I would need to get the lowest level configuration existing  
16:49 <acotiuga> has quit  
16:51 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
17:37 <ujjwal> has quit  
18:07 <cjd> has quit  
18:13 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> has joined #xwiki  
18:16 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> hello. i have worked hands-on with chart.js before. I was trying to find more information regarding the chart.js integretion. Where can i find it?  
18:16 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> the project details.  
18:24 <ujjwal> has joined #xwiki  
18:26 <tmortagne> xwikiorg\_guest\_8: I guess you looked at http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/ChartjsIntegration description already, I don't know much about this sorry but mflorea should have more details  
18:26 <evalica> xwikiorg\_guest\_8: the project details are at http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/ChartjsIntegration  
18:26 <evalica> :)  
18:28 <mflorea> xwikiorg\_guest\_8: the idea is to make a proposal on how to integrate chart.js in XWiki, I'm not sure what more information are you looking for  
18:29 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> okay thankx a lot  
18:31 <mflorea> xwikiorg\_guest\_8: let me know if you have questions
